text.value: Why is ethanol classified as a primary alcohol?

value.value: The carbon bonded to the functional group is bonded to one other carbon atom.
Ethanol contains only one OH group
The carbon chain in a molecule of ethanol is not branched
Due to ethanol being produced naturally.
Consider how many carbon atoms the carbon bonded to the function group is bonded to.
Secondary and tertiary alcohols can also only contain one OH group
Tertiary alcohols must contain a branched carbon chain. Secondary alcohols could contain a branched carbon chain.
The classification of alcohols is based on their structure.
